@ModeledBehavior @graykimbrough @UpdatedPriors @conorsen @ryanavent I'd be very interested to see the sub-networks of agencies that work together. But I imagine many will include WH or Cong.
@ModeledBehavior @graykimbrough @UpdatedPriors @conorsen @ryanavent But main agglomeration (in public interest) is between gov't agencies themselves.
@ModeledBehavior @UpdatedPriors @conorsen @ryanavent There are def some that could go, like CDC. (NSF?) But most need proximity to WH (like def) or oth agencies. But spec. ex's r compelling
@UpdatedPriors @ModeledBehavior @conorsen @ryanavent Example: You might think NOAA could be just anywhere. But NOAA and NASA work a lot (at least pre-Trump) with EPA, who prob should be near WH
@UpdatedPriors @ModeledBehavior @conorsen @ryanavent I would be more sympathetic to concrete suggestions like these. But many orgs need to be close to exec. branch, 1st or 2nd deg connection 1/
@graykimbrough that's quite an improvement
@graykimbrough What are you using to plot that? ggplot?
